search_results.snippet: Smelting is a form of extractive metallurgy; its main use is to produce a base metal from its ore. This includes production of silver, iron, copper and other base metals from their ores. ... As most ores are impure, it is often necessary to use flux, such as limestone, to remove the accompanying rock gangue as slag.
search_results.title: Smelting - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet: Century Dictionary speculates it means "smooth" and compares Old English smeolt, smylt "serene, smooth." To melt ores in order to extract the metals they contain. Oxide ores, such as iron ore, are smelted with carbon, which serves as a fuel and changes the ore into a reduced metal.
